page.syntax: Output_String as C = STRWORDITRAN(C character,C substring,[C replacement,[N start_pos,[N occurrences[,N every]]]])

argument.name: substring
argument.description: The word to find in the Input_String.

argument.name: replacement
argument.description: Default = "" (NULL). The word that replaces the Find_Word. Optional.

argument.name: start_pos
argument.description: Default = 1. Specifies which (and subsequent) occurrences will be replaced. A value N for the optional Start_Word begins the replacement at the N th occurrence of Find_Word. Numeric

argument.name: occurrences
argument.description: Optional. Default = All. Specifies the maximum number of occurrences of Find_String to replace with Replace_String. Numeric

page.description: Replaces each occurrence of a word with another - compare is case insensitive.
page.discussion: Looks for a Find_Word in a Input_String, and replaces every occurrence of it with a Replacement_Word. If Replacement_Word is omitted, Find_Word is replaced with NULL characters. A value N for the optional Start_Word begins the replacement at the N th occurrence of Word. A value for the optional Occurrences specifies the maximum number of occurrences of Word to be replaced. STRWORDITRAN() is case insensitive. Note : You can use STRWORDTRAN() with memo fields.
page.example: strworditran("partnership is the most important part of part of a successful relationship", "part", "element") -> "partnership is the most important element of element of a successful relationship" STRTRAN("partnership is the most important part of part of a successful relationship", "part", "element") -> "elementnership is the most important element of element of a successful relationship" strworditran("She sells sea shell on the sea shore","sea","ocean", 2, 1) -> "She sells sea shell on the ocean shore"
